Package src.scenes

Class Scene

java.lang.Object
src.scenes.Scene
Direct Known Subclasses:
Menu, MineField
public class Scene extends Object
Baseclass for any Scene.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scene

      public Scene(boolean isMenu, String TAG)
      Initialises the lists Entities, Components and Buttons. Properties from these lists will be drawn in the Renderer.
      Parameters:
      isMenu - determines, if the Scene is considered a Menu
      TAG - scene identifier

  • Method Details

    • setBGM

      public void setBGM(String filename)
      Takes the name of a audio file, loads the resource and sets it as bgm.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the audio file to be loaded.

    • start

      public void start()
      Collects all operations to be done, when the Scene is started.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Collects all operations to be done, when the Scene is stoped.

    • update

      public void update()
      Calls the update method of all Components.

    • getCounter

      public int getCounter()
      Returns the counter of the Scene. The counter is used for time based events.
      Returns:
      Scene counter.

    • getMenu

      public boolean getMenu()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the Scene is considered a Menu.
      Returns:
      true, if the Scene is considered a Menu

    • setBG

      public void setBG(String bgName)
      Set the Background image for your Scene object. If not set the Background will be black. Creates a new Component object to hold the image. Registers the image to the components list of your scene.
      Parameters:
      bgName - the name like "image.png" of your image in src/resources/assets/
      See Also:
      • Component

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns true, if the Scene is currently active.
      Returns:
      true, if the Scene is currently active.

    • updateMouseLocation

      public void updateMouseLocation(int x, int y)
      Takes x and y coordinates and stores them in the mousepoint variable
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate a new location
      y - y coordinate a new location

    • getMousePoint

      public Point getMousePoint()
      returns the private mousepoint variable
      Returns:
      the private Point object mousepoint
